thread.title: Cycling Girona – A Video Tour of Medieval Castles and the Catalan Countryside
thread.title_full: Cycling Girona – A Video Tour of Medieval Castles and the Catalan Countryside

author: Dave and Deb
title: Cycling Girona – A Video Tour of Medieval Castles and the Catalan Countryside
text:
No Comments » • Active Travel , Spain Cycling Girona is a must when visiting the Spanish region of Catalunya. 
It is one of the premier destinations for cycling in Europe. The city of Girona is home to many professional cyclists who frequent the area each season to train in the nearby Pyrenees. Girona has it all, quiet countryside, epic mountain climbs and it’s a world leader in cuisine with more Michelin star restaurants per capita than anywhere else. It’s no wonder all the best cyclists want to spend their days here. They get to ride through beauty each day and enjoy the Catalan culture and cuisine by night. Who could ask for more? If you are wondering what it’s like to go cycling in Girona, check out our video, it captures our day tour through medieval castles and the gorgeous countryside. 
See more cycling tours at Four Unique Things to do in Switzerland Cycling Girona 
There are several cycling tours you can do in Girona. You can go on your own or with a guide. Not everyone can pack up their bicycle and take it with them as they travel around Europe, but BikeCat located in the heart of the old town of Girona rents impeccable bikes. These babies were used by Team Garmin in the Tour de France. Team Garmin trains in Girona so you know you are getting only the best. We absolutely loved our day with Jaume: The owner and operator of BikeCat. He took us through a 40km loop following the Medieval village tour. We stopped for lunch and coffee along the way and explore the back alleyways and streets. It was an absolutely stunning ride. 
See our cycling trip through Africa Dave and Deb enjoying the Catalan Countryside 
We hope you enjoyed our travel video of the week! We’ll be sharing a weekly video each Sunday. Stay tuned for the next one! For more information on cycling Girona, visit BikeCat’s website Our trip to Girona was sponsored by Visit Costa Brava You Might Also Enjoy:
